dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazhydromet is calling for a seriously unstable June across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazhydromet is calling for a seriously unstable June across Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unstable conditions are expected throughout the month " alternating between cool and hot spells, accompanied by rain (sometimes heavy), thunderstorms, hail, and squally winds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, alternating between cool and hot spells, right? With all kinds of wild stuff—rain, thunderstorms, even hail and squally winds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, alternating between cool and hot spells, right? With all kinds of wild stuff-rain, thunderstorms, even hail and squally winds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Unstable conditions are expected throughout the month " alternating between cool and hot spells, accompanied by rain (sometimes heavy), thunderstorms, hail, and squally winds.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And dust storms on some days, which, you know, can really reduce visibility and air quality.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And dust storms on some days, which, you know, can really reduce visibility and air quality.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On some days, dust storms are also possible.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But the overall trend is rising temperatures, which is kind of expected for summer, but then they're also predicting these frequent short-term rains.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But the overall trend is rising temperatures, which is kind of expected for summer, but then they're also predicting these frequent short-term rains.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Against a backdrop of rising temperatures across all regions, frequent short-term rains are forecast.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, so it's not just a steady heatwave. Like in the West, nighttime temps are gonna drop from the low 20s down to like +7 to +12 Celsius in the first half of the month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, so it's not just a steady heatwave. Like in the West, nighttime temps are gonna drop from the low 20s down to like +seven to +twelve Celsius in the first half of the month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: West: In the first half of June, nighttime temperatures will drop from +17...+22ÂC to +7...+12ÂC, and daytime temperatures from +27...+32ÂC to +20...+25ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's a pretty significant swing! And daytime temps there could go from up to +32 down to around +20 or so.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's a pretty significant swing! And daytime temps there could go from up to +thirty two down to around +twenty or so.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: West: In the first half of June, nighttime temperatures will drop from +17...+22ÂC to +7...+12ÂC, and daytime temperatures from +27...+32ÂC to +20...+25ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Meanwhile, the South is just baking. Nighttime temps staying hot, like +20 to +28, and daytime hitting up to +43 Celsius in some spots.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Meanwhile, the South is just baking. Nighttime temps staying hot, like +twenty to +twenty eight, and daytime hitting up to +forty three Celsius in some spots.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: South: Even nighttime temperatures will be hot " ranging from +20...+28ÂC, and daytime up to +35...+43ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Forty-three! That is intense. I mean, that's desert-level heat right there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forty-three! That is intense. I mean, that's desert-level heat right there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But even there, they're expecting a slight cooldown by mid-June, down to maybe +28 to +33, which is still plenty warm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But even there, they're expecting a slight cooldown by mid-June, down to maybe +twenty eight to +thirty three, which is still plenty warm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, a slight drop to +28...+33ÂC is expected by mid-June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And the Southeast is gradually warming up, which is interesting—nighttime going from around +10 to +15 up to +15 to +20.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And the Southeast is gradually warming up, which is interesting-nighttime going from around +ten to +fifteen up to +fifteen to +twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Southeast: Gradual warming is forecast " nighttime temperatures will rise from +10...+15ÂC to +15...+20ÂC, and daytime from +20...+25ÂC to +30...+35ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and mountainous areas will see nights warming from just above freezing, like +2 to +7, up to more comfortable levels.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and mountainous areas will see nights warming from just above freezing, like +two to +seven, up to more comfortable levels.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In mountainous areas, nights will warm from +2...+7ÂC to +7...+12ÂC, and days from +10...+15ÂC to +20...+25ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So it sounds like no matter where you are in Kazakhstan, you've gotta be ready for anything—from near-freezing at night in the mountains to scorching afternoons in the south.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So it sounds like no matter where you are in Kazakhstan, you've gotta be ready for anything-from near-freezing at night in the mountains to scorching afternoons in the south.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In mountainous areas, nights will warm from +2...+7ÂC to +7...+12ÂC, and days from +10...+15ÂC to +20...+25ÂC. In the far southwest and south, temperatures may climb to +43ÂC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Pack layers, maybe an umbrella, and definitely sunscreen.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Pack layers, maybe an umbrella, and definitely sunscreen.
